alert.note: Alert for Ashley (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Ashley County through 730 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wilmot to near West Crossett. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Old Milo around 710 PM CDT. Fountain Hill around 720 PM CDT. Snyder around 725 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Blanchton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
